Yelena requested a loan in the amount of 15 000 hryvnia from Kiva with the intention to purchase seasonal merchandise for the summer.  She knows that leather women's shoes are the most popular types of merchandise among her customers, and this is why she wanted to refill her inventory for subsequent sale.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise for the summer

loans.name: Stepan

texts.ru:
Степан женат. У него один ребенок. Степан имеет собственный бизнес. 

Степан торгует промышленными товарами на рынке на протяжении 10 лет.  Он трудолюбивый и насточивый. Степан знает на какой товар есть спрос и всегда старается предоставить его клиентам по уместной цене.

Степан просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 10000 гривен на расширение ассортимента твоего товара. Дополнительную прибыль он собирается потратить на отдых со своей семьей и также вложить в бизнес.
texts.en: Stepan is married and has one child.  Stepan has his own business and has been selling household goods at a market for ten years.  He is hardworking and persistent.  Stepan knows what type of merchandise is in demand and always tries to offer it to his customers at a reasonable price.  Stepan is requesting a loan in the amount of 10 000 hryvnia to expand his merchandise selection.  He plans to spend the additional profit to vacation with his family and invest into his business.

loans.use: to expand merchandise selection

loans.name: Srwr

texts.en:
Srwr is 35 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen.  He is married and has four children. 

For several years he has prepared and sold sweets.  He sells sweets and profits increase his working capital, because at this time his customer count is growing. 

He is a person who greatly wants to succeed and who works hard to provide a better future for his children.

Srwr is requesting a loan of 130000 YER to buy supplies, such as sugar, cooking oil…etc.  He hopes to expand his business and increase his capital.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as sugar, cooking oil…etc.

loans.name: Nason

texts.en:
Nason is a 40-year-old married man with five children. They live in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He owns a retail shop and has been in the business for seven years. Inadequate capital to purchase stock, seasonal weather and price fluctuations are the main hardships the client faces. 

He wants to build a house and educate his children. His business goals are to expand the business into new markets and to hire employees to help expand the business.The purpose of the loan is to buy salt, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and soap for resale.

loans.name: Misionera Group

texts.es:
El grupo Misioneras lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Luz Marina de 37 años quien se dedica a la venta de CD desde hace 2 años y pasteles desde hace 4 meses en este último negocio es el que invertirá el crédito para reforzarlo. Ella tiene tres hijos de 14, 17 y 18 años los cuales le ayudan en el negocio.

Las otras integrantes son Rosa Melida quien se dedica al comercio de prendasdesde hace 3 años y Fidelia tiene una refresquería y se dedica a la costura desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The 'Misioneras' group is made up of three hard-working, entrepreneurial people.  One of them is 37-year-old Luz Marina who has been selling CDs for two years and cakes for four months.  She will invest her loan in the cake business in order to strengthen it.  Luz has three children who are 14, 17 and 18 years old.  They help her in her business.

The other members of this group are Rosa Melida, who has been selling clothing for three years, and Fidelia, who has a drinks stand and has also run a sewing business for two years.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: St Amedio Katwe Group

texts.en:
John Baptist is a 52-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling fish for 25 years. His hardships are seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase enough fish to meet the demand. 

His goals are diversifying his business to include produce sales and buying land to grow crops. John wants money to buy fish for resale. 

He is a member of the group in the photo, in which each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Karla's Group

texts.es:
El grupo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Santos de 48 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa desde hace 4 años negocio que lo inicio vendiendo crema luego lo fue ampliando. Ella tiene un hijo de 17 años con capacidades de diferentes. 
Las otras integrantes son Sugey Magali quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado desde hace 4 años y Karla quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hard-working, entrepreneurial people.  One of them is 48-year-old Santos who has been selling cosmetics and clothing for four years.  She started out in her business selling cream and then expanded.  She has one son who is 17 years old and differently abled.

The other members of the group are Sugey Magalia, who has been selling clothing and footwear for four years, and Karla, who has run a grocery store for three years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 40-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan who has four family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy clothes that she will sell to increase her family's income and their standard of living. 

* Nawal prefers not to display her photo on the internet, thus the above photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for clothes that will be sold

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man with five children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in a produce business and he has been in business for a period of five years .He started by practicing agriculture. Then he saved and started buying produce. He says the high cost of fuel, transport costs and inadequate capital are affecting the business. He would like to educate his children and expand his business into new markets. Julius wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Sinaou Group

texts.fr: Cultivateur de profession, Mr Essodina est père de 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Le plus jeune a 2ans et demi et l’ainé 12ans. Sa  conjointe exerce la même activité que lui. Il a démarré son activité qu’il exerce avec 04 personnes en RÉGION CENTRALE depuis 25ans. Ses achats aussi se font dans la même zone et dans les villes environnantes. Il veut s’acheter un moyen de déplacement et construire un logement avec les profits réalisés. Dans l’avenir, il veut augmenter sa superficie et  assurer les besoins primaires de la famille. Il sait bien jouer  son rôle de responsable c’est pour cela il  a été choisi par ses collègues pour être le président du groupement nommé SINAOU. C’est un groupement dans lequel tous sont basés dans l’agriculture. Ils sont dans la culture d’igname, de mais, du coton, du riz et sollicitent ce prêt de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en outils de travail afin d’avoir un bon rendement et assurer les besoins élémentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
A farmer by trade, Essodina is a father of four children, three of whom are at school. The youngest is 2 years of age, while the oldest is 12. His wife works in the same profession as he does. 

Essodina started his business with four people in the Central Region 25 years ago. He buys his supplies in the same area, as well as in the surrounding villages. He wants to buy a means of transport and to build a house with the profits he makes and, in the future, would like to increase his land and provide for his family’s basic needs. 

Essodina knows how to be responsible, and this is why his colleagues have chosen him as the president of the group called Sinaou. All the members of this group work in agriculture, growing yams, corn, cotton and rice. They have requested this loan from WAGES to buy work tools, so that they can have a good harvest and ensure that their families’ basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy work tools.

loans.name: Abaramye Group

texts.fr:
Marie fait partie du groupe Abaramye et habite à Gitega. Elle a  57 ans et est mariée à Tharcisse, commerçant et cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants, dont  2 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de l’huile de palme depuis 20 ans.

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de litres de l’huile de palme  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait continuer son commerce et espère avoir beaucoup de  bénéfices.
texts.en:
Marie is part of the Abaramye group and lives in Gitega. She is 57 years of age and is married to Tharcisse, a retailer and farmer. They have five children together, two of whom are at school.

Marie has sold palm oil for 20 years. This is her fourth loan with Turame. She plans to use her Kiva loan to increase her capital and buy lots of liters of palm oil, which she will resell to earn more money. Over the coming years she would like to continue with her business, and hopes to make lots of profit.

loans.use: To increase her capital and buy many liters of palm oil which she will resell to earn more money.

loans.name: Ganna

texts.ru:
Ганна живет в Виноградове. Она торгует женской одеждой: кофтами, рубашками, костюмами и т.д., а также подростковой и детской одеждой. Торговая точка находится на одном из местных рынков. Ганна торгует уже 4 года. Бизнес помогает выжить в непростое время, ведь совсем недавно у Ганны на заработках умер супруг и она осталась единственной кормилицей в своей семье. Ганна серьезная, трудолюбивая, ответственная.

Ганна хочет вложить кредит в размере 15 000 гривен в пополнение запаса товара, так как планирует раскручивать бизнес, а товара недостаточно. Ганна видит перспективы роста, и намерена дополнительную прибыль, полученную от реализации предыдущей партии товара, снова вложить в свое дело. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Ganna lives in Vinogradovo.  She sells women's clothing: blouses, shirts, suits, etc., and also adolescent and children's clothing.  Her retail outlet is located at one of the local markets.  Ganna has been in sales for four years.  The business helps her to survive in a difficult time, especially since her husband recently died at work, and she was left as the sole provider for her family.  Ganna is serious, hardworking and responsible.  She wants to invest a loan in the amount of 15 000 hryvnia into refilling her merchandise inventory because she plans to expand her business, but does not have enough merchandise.  Ganna sees a promise for a future growth and intends to invest the additional profit from selling the last merchandise inventory into her business.

loans.use: to refill merchandise inventory by purchasing adolescent and children's clothing

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es:
Doña Sandra Margarita tiene 59 años de edad, es casada y madre de cuatros hijos, reside en el Barrio La Hoya en el municipio de Juticalpa y se dedica a la venta de rosquillas y quesadillas.

Doña Sandra aprendió a elaborar las rosquillas y quesadillas desde hace mas de 30 años y se formó trabajando con una vecina que se dedicaba a esa actividad. Su producto es muy preferido por la población Juticalpense y también por las personas que viven en el extranjero, ya que la mayor cantidad de su producto se le compran para enviarlo a familiares o amigos que viven en los Estados Unidos. Trabaja en conjunto con su hijo menor, su jornada laboral inicia a las 4:00 am lo cual es muy sacrificado pero una vez que el producto sale del horno ella puede descansar y su hijo despacha a los clientes. 

El préstamo que Doña Sandra esta solicitando lo necesita para comprar leche, maíz, azúcar, leña, huevos, entre otros productos para la elaboración de las rosquillas y quesadillas. Con el apoyo del préstamo Doña Sandra podrá sacar unos pedidos que tiene pendientes de entrega y eso le generara ganancias para cubrir algunos gastos del hogar como ser el pago de alquiler.
texts.en:
Sandra Margarita, 59, is married and the mother of four children.  She lives in the La Hoya neighborhood in Juticalpa Municipality.  She sells ‘rosquillas’ [cookies] and quesadillas.

Sandra learned to make rosquillas and quesadillas over 30 years ago and started working with a neighbor who worked in this activity.  Her products are preferred by Juticalpa residents and also by people living abroad since most of her product is purchased to be shipped to relatives or friends living in the United States.  She works with her youngest son and her work day starts at 4am which is very demanding.  However, once the product is out of the oven she can rest while her son takes care of customers.

The loan Sandra is requesting is needed to buy milk, corn, sugar, firewood and eggs among other products to make rosquillas and quesadillas.  With support from the loan, Sandra will be able to fill some pending orders she has which will generate profits to cover some household expense like rent.

loans.use: to buy milk, corn, sugar, firewood and eggs among other products.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is an 18-year-old man from Sahab, Jorda.  He is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to buy goods that he will be selling. In the future, he will open a shop. Since Mohammad is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for goods to sell in his shop

loans.name: Liliya

texts.ru:
Лилия уже 14 лет работает в сфере реализации продуктов питания в рыночных условиях. Она живет и работает в Мелитополе, торгует на местном привокзальном рынке чаем и кофе, пакетированным и развесным. У нее собственное торговое место. 

Лилия любит работать с указанной группой товара. Она мастерски разбирается в качестве реализуемых напитков, всегда может дать дельный совет покупателям, подсказать что-то интересное из новинок. Лилия сумела зарекомендовать себя как мудрый и внимательный к спросу покупателей продавец, поэтому смогла наработать хорошую базу постоянных клиентов и продолжает приобретать все новых. В этот раз Лиле необходим кредит в размере 14 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить партию цветочных, травяных легких чаев, которые быстро расходятся летом, а также приобрести несколько разновидностей кофе разных брендов для реализации в своем киоске.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Liliya has been working in the business of selling food products in market conditions for 14 years.  She lives and works in Melitopol, where she sells tea and coffee, bagged and loose, at a local market.  She owns her retail outlet.  Liliya loves to work with these merchandise types.  She is a master at knowing the beverages she sells and can always offer a good advice to her customers, and let them know what new and interesting products she has.  Liliya was able to recommend herself as a salesperson, who is wise and attentive to her customer requests, and this is why she was able to gain a good base of regular customers and continues to attract new ones.  This time, Liliya needs a loan in the amount of 14 000 hryvnia to purchase an inventory of flower and herb light teas, which are quickly sold in the summer, and also to purchase several varieties of different brands of coffee to sell at her kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of flower and herb light teas, which are quickly sold in the summer, and also to purchase several varieties of different brands of coffee to sell at her kiosk

loans.name: Léocadie Léonie

texts.fr: Léocadie Léonie est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27 ans et le moins âgé a 11 ans. Ses enfants sont tous scolarisés. Elle vend de la nourriture depuis des années. Léocadie Léonie s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Ses clients sont composés des habitants du quartier et de ses environs. Léocadie Léonie veut s'acheter des sacs de riz, de maïs, des paniers de tomate et du poisson. Léocadie Léonie avec ses économies veut renforcer son fonds de commerce et participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Léocadie Léonie is married and the mother of six. The oldest is 27 years old, and the youngest is 11. Her children are all in school. She has been selling food for  a number of years. Léocadie Léonie  stocks up at a market in Benin. Her clients live in the neighborhood and nearby. Léocadie Léonie would like to buy some bags of rice and corn, baskets of tomatoes and fish. She would like to use her savings to bolster her working capital and contribute to the education expenses for her children.

loans.use: to buy five bags of rice, 10  bags of cron, 3  basket of tomatoes  and one box of fish.

loans.name: Hourèye

texts.fr:
Hourey âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de famille habite dans la ville principale. Elle achète  des prêts à porter pour enfants et des produits de mercerie à Dakar pour ensuite les revendre, elle a une cantine où les marchandises sont stockées au niveau de son domicile. Elle s’exerce dans cette activité depuis 10 ans et dans le cadre de renforcement de ses capacités d’exploitation elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000.De ce fait elle pourra acheter plus de marchandises  pour faire face à la demande et avoir plus de bénéfices.
Avec ce bénéfice elle pourra prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et augmenter son fond de roulement .
texts.en:
Hourey is 40 years of age and a married mother, and lives in the main city. She buys ready-to-wear clothing for children and sewing products in Dakar, which she then resells. She has a small store at home where she stocks her merchandise, and has worked in this business for 10 years. 

To increase her operating capacity, Hourey has requested a loan of 500,000 XOF. This will allow her to buy more merchandise to meet demand, and to have greater profits. She plans to use these profits to cover her personal needs and increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy ready-to-wear clothing for children and sewing products in Dakar for resale.

loans.name: Confesora

texts.es:
Con 21,000 pesos Confesora podrá comprar mercancía para aumentar el inventario de su tienda. Hace cuatro años que confesora comenzó vendiendo cosméticos a sus amigas y su negocio fué creciendo hasta que logró instalar esta tienda. Confesora es casada, su esposo es maestro de escuela primaria. Tienen dos hijos de 12 y 15 años que asisten a la escuela.
Confesora sólo pudo completar la secundaria y no pudo ir a la universidad a estudiar come le hubiera gustado, por lo que su sueño es que su negocio siga funcionando de manera estable para asi poder enviar a sus hijos a la universidad.
texts.en:
With 21,000 pesos, Confesora will be able to buy merchandise to increase her store's inventory. Four years ago Confesora started selling cosmetics to her friends and her business began to grow until she was able to occupy this store. 

Confesora is married and her husband is a primary school teacher. They have two children who are 12 and 15 years old and go to school. Confesora was only able to complete scondary school and was not able to go to university and study as she would have liked to. This is why her dream is that her business will continue to be stable and function so that she will be able to send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose est une dame âgée de 53ans, divorcée et mère de  05 enfants dont l'age varie entre 19 et 30 ans et parmi lesquels 03 vont à l’école. comme activité elle élève les poulets à son domicile depuis trois ans. avec ce crédit elle voudrait acheter des poussins et des aliments(provende,soja, etc...) pour pouvoir augmenter sa capacité de production. Les revenus supplémentaire générés seront réinvestis dans son activité dans le but de la faire grandir d'avantage
texts.en:
Rose is a 53-year-old divorced woman, who is mother to five children aged between 19 and 30 years of age. Three of her children go to school. 

Rose works raising chicks at home, and has done so for three years. She would like to use this loan to buy chicks and feed (animal feed, soybeans, etc.) to increase her production capacity. The additional income generated will be reinvested in her business, so that it can grow even more.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Solim Group

texts.fr: Mr Egoulou est né en 1961. Il est marié à une cultivatrice et ont 07 enfants. Quatre sont sur les bancs d’école et ils ont entre 25 et 08ans. Il est à son troisième crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des outils de travail pour son activité d’agriculture.  Il est dans ce domaine il y a plus de 34ans. 03 personnes l’aident dans l’exécution de sa tache et tout le travail se déroule en RÉGION CENTRALE.  Il est le responsable du groupement « SOLIM » et sont tous dans le domaine de l’agriculture. Tous sollicitent ce montant pour acheter des outils afin d’avoir un bon rendement. Ils veulent agrandir leurs superficies et assurer les besoins vitaux de leurs familles.
texts.en:
Egoulou was born in 1961. He is married to a farmer, and they have seven children, four of whom go to school. His children are aged between 8 and 25 years of age.

Egoulou is on his third WAGES loan, and has requested this one to buy work tools for his agriculture business. He has worked in this field for more than 34 years, and three people help him with his tasks. All his work is carried out in the Central Region. 

Egoulou is the head of the Solim group, and all of the group’s members work in agriculture. They have all requested this sum of money to buy work tools, so that they can have a good harvest. They want to increase their land, and to provide for the basic needs of their families.

loans.use: To buy work tools.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa nació en Colta considerada una de las ciudades más alta del Ecuador con una altitud promedio de 3.212 msnm y cuya temperatura media es de 12 °C. Ella nos comenta que su ciudad es muy hermosa pero se vio en la necesidad de trasladarse a vivir a Guayaquil con el fin de mejorar su forma de vida. Josefa tiene 38 años y migro con toda su familia hace muchos años, no se queja ya que tiene su negocio y le va muy bien. Vive en el Fortín en la casa de sus padres ya que es madre soltera. Josefa tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual abrió hace 7 años con la ayuda de sus padres. Al principio no estaba muy surtida pero con el pasar los años a ido ganando clientela y ahora cuenta con un inventario muy amplio. El negocio lo atiende sola desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Ella nos comenta que lo que más vende son verduras ya que las compra temprano en la mañana y son las más frescas por su sector, eso le hace ganar clientes. Josefa solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, cloro, verduras con el fin de mejorar sus ventas. Su sueño es poder tener su casa donde pueda abrir su negocio y ayudar a su hijo a terminar la escuela.
texts.en:
Josefa was born in Colta considered to be one of Ecuador’s highest cities with an average altitude of 3,212 meters above sea level and an average temperature of 12 °C.  She tells us that her city is very beautiful but she was faced with the need to relocate to Guayaquil in order to improve her way of life.

Josefa is 38-years-old and moved with her entire family many years ago.  She doesn’t complain because she has her business and does very well.  She lives in Fortín in her parents’ house since she’s a single mother.

Josefa has a grocery store she opened 7 years ago with help from her parents.  At the beginning it wasn’t very well-stocked but with the passage of time she’s been generating customers and now she has an extensive inventory.  Her store is open from 6am until 8pm.  She comments that what sells the most is vegetables since she buys them very early in the morning so they are the freshest in her zone; this leads to her winning over customers.

Josefa has requested the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, chlorine bleach and vegetables in order to improve sales.  Her dream is to have a house of her own where she can open her business and help her son complete his schooling.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Oscar Oswaldo

texts.es: Oscar vive en el Suburbio zona sur de Guayaquil. Tiene 35 años de edad y está casado con Azucena. Su esposa es ama de casa y cuida de sus 3 hijos. Oscar tiene en su domicilio una venta de bidones de agua. El negocio lo empezó hace 9 años ya que necesitaba tener ingresos extras para su familia. También trabaja de vendedor de artefactos electrodomésticos en la casa comercial pero más ganancias le dejan su negocio propio. Nos comenta que lo realiza de lunes a viernes en la tarde pero el fin de semana todo el día. Su trabajo consiste en comprar a 0.80 ctv el botellón y lo vende a 1.50 teniendo así una ganancia de 0.70 ctv. Al principio estaba escéptico pensando que no tendría acogida pero ahora se sorprende la cantidad de personas que compran el agua de esta manera, sus clientes frecuentes son las pequeñas empresas ya que compran para los surtidores de agua. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de bidones de agua para tener almacenado en su negocio. Oscar nos menciona que lo que más desea es comprar un vehículo con el que podría dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Oscar lives in Suburbio in south Guayaquil.  He’s 35-years-old and married to Azucena.  His wife is a housewife and cares for their three children.  

Oscar sells bottled water at home.  He started the business nine years ago because he needed to earn extra money for his family.  He also works as a home appliance salesman in a store but his own business produces more profits.  

He comments that he works Monday through Friday in the afternoon but all day on weekends.  His work consists in buying the bottles for 80 cents each and selling them for 1.50 thus earning 70 cents profit.  At the beginning he was skeptical thinking that he’d not have much demand but he’s surprised at the number of people who buy water this way.  His frequent customers are small firms that buy for water distributors.  

The loan he’s asking for is to buy bottles of water to stock in his business.  Oscar mentions that what he wants most is to buy a vehicle with which to provide improved customer service.

loans.use: to buy large bottles of water.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 29-year-old hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been dealing in the transport business for seven years. He used to drive vehicles for other people until recently when he accumulated capital and managed to buy his own, although he has paid only half the price so far. His business is affected by the high fuel costs and taxes. He would like to work hard to ensure that he builds a permanent home and buys land for growing crops. Joseph wants a loan to complete payment of his motor vehicle.

loans.use: to complete payment of his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Charles Ismail

texts.en: Charles Ismail is a 34-year-old ambitious man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has a boutique business, which he has run for a period of nine years. He started as a hawker in different markets for three years. Then got capital and started this business. He says inadequate capital and price fluctuations are affecting the business. Charles Ismail would like to educate his children and buy land to grow crops. He wants a loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Juana Emilia

texts.es:
Con 10,600 pesos Juana podrá comprar los materiales que necesita pra mejorar el local donde actualemnte tiene su puesto de venta de comida. A Juana le encanta cocinar, es por esto que decidió hace 5 años iniciar un puesto de venta de comida, donde pudiera ganarse algunos pesos y ayudar a su esposo en la manutención de la casa. Juana tiene tres hijos de 30,26 y 24 años, los dos mayores se casaron y el menor aun vive en la casa con ella y su esposo.
Juana quiere que le vaya bien en su negocio para poder ahorrar y terminar de construir su casa, la cual comenzó hace casi dos años.  Es por esto que quiere mejorar el local de su negocio, para darle un buen servicio a sus clientes actuales y atraer a otros clientes.
texts.en:
With 10,600 pesos, Juana will be able to buy the materials she needs to improve the storefront where she currently has her stand selling food. Juana loves to cook, which is why she decided five years ago to start a standing selling food where she could make some money and help her husband in supporting their home. 

Juana has three children who are 30, 26 and 24 years old. The two oldest are married and the youngest still lives at home with her and her husband. 

Juana wants her business to go well so that she will be able to save and finish building her house, which she started almost two years ago. This is why she wants to improve the storefront where her business is, so that she can offer better service to her current customers and attract others.

loans.use: to fix her business' storefront.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 36-year-old gentleman who deals in a spare parts business that he has run for a period of two years. He says that inadequate capital and high transport costs are affecting the business. He would like to educate his children and expand his business to new markets. Vincent wants a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина живет в городе Запорожье. Она уже не первый год работает в сфере торговли на одном из самых крупных рынков города, реализуя женскую обувь, тапочки, шнурки и аксессуары для обуви. У Ирины есть два своих торговых места. 

Ирина планирует вложить кредит в 21 000 гривен в ремонт и переоборудование недавно приобретенного нового прилавка и закупку зимнего товара по низкой закупочной цене. На оптовых базах часто цены на обувь следующего сезона бывают доступнее для торговцев-предпринимателей, если заказывать товар заранее. Ирина всегда была прагматичной, и умело рассчитывала свои средства. Она надеется и в этот раз мудро вложить полученные от КИВА средства, а со временем даже расширить новое место, зашить прилавок и поставить там ролеты.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Irina lives in the city of Zaporozhye.  This is not her first year working in the sales field and selling women's shoes, slippers, shoe laces and shoe accessories at one of the largest city markets.  Irina owns two retail outlets.  She plans to invest the loan in the amount of 21 000 hryvnia into repairing and remodeling her new retail counter and purchasing winter merchandise at a low purchase price.  Wholesale markets often have more affordable prices for next season shoes for sellers-entrepreneurs, if the merchandise is ordered in advance.  Irina has always been pragmatic and able to balance her finances well.  She hopes that to invest the money received from Kiva wisely once again and with time even expand her new retail outlet by expanding the counter and installing blinds there.

loans.use: to make repairs and remodel her recently purchased new counter and to purchase winter merchandise at a low purchase price

loans.name: Mikhail

texts.ru:
Михаил женат. У него двое детей. Михаил работает слесарем по ремонту автомобилей в частной охранной фирме. Он трудолюбивый и ответственный. Михаил имеет отличную кридитную историю.

Михаил просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 5000 гривен на покупку холодильника. Он собирается сделать косметический ремонт в кухне и поставить туда новый холодильник.
texts.en: Mikhail is married and has two children.  He works as mechanic, who repairs cars at a private security firm.  He is hardworking and responsible.  Mikhail has an excellent credit history.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 hryvnia to purchase a refrigerator.  He plans to make cosmetic repairs in his kitchen and install a new refrigerator there.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Nailan

texts.es:
Con 42,000 pesos Nailan podrá comprar mercancía para su puesto de viveres y verduras. Hace 12 años que Nailan decidió instalar este puesto de viveres y verduras en el mercado local, por recomendación de uno de sus hermanos y no se lamenta de haber tomado el consejo.
Con este préstamo Nailan también está planificando hacer algunos arreglos a su puesto de verduras, para poder dar un mejor servivio a sus clientes.
Juana es casada, su esposo trabaja para la compañía electrica. Tienen 5 hijos de 19,15, 13, 11 y 9 años. El mayor ya está en la universidad y los demás en la escuela. Todos sus hijos toman turnos en la semana para ayudarla en el puesto de verduras cuando salen de la escuela. Sus hijos son la razón por la que se levanta todos los días de madrugada para escoger las verduras más frescas. Quiere que sus hijos continúen estudiando y que como el mayor asistan a la universidad
texts.en:
With 42,000 pesos, Nailan will be able to purchase merchandise for her vegetable and grocery stand. Twelve years ago Nailan decided to start this vegetable and grocery stand in the local market. One of her siblings recommended it and she does not regret having taken the advice. Nailan also wants to make a few repairs to her vegetable stand with this loan so that she can offer better service to her customers. 

Juana is married and her husband works for the electric company. They have five children who are 19, 15, 13, and 11 years old. The eldest is at university and the other are in school. All of her children take turns during the week to help her at the vegetable stand when they get our of school. Her children are the reason why she gets up early every morning to select the freshest vegetables. She wants her children to continue studying and just like her eldest, go to university.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her vegetable stand.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena de cuarenta y ocho años de edad  vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, deportivos, casuales, de vestir todos para damas y caballeros, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este negocio y tiene experiencia en las ventas, una de sus mayores ventajas frente a la competencia es la amabilidad con las personas que la visitan, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad de producto que vende, los buenos precios, pero sobre todo el servicio inigualable; María es una mujer muy entregada a su labor dispuesta siempre a dar todo de su parte para salir adelante, esta consiente que solo con trabajo constante y motivación logrará el éxito; es muy motivada asegura que en esta temporada de venta sus ganancias aumentaran, quiere invertir en más producto pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar zapatos por mayor. María Magdalena tiene buenas referencias de pago y tiene  una moral intachable, asegura que podrá  cancelar el financiamiento y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Magdalena is 48, and lives with her life companion in their own house. She sells all kinds of men's and women's shoes: sport, casual and dress shoes. She has been working in this business for many years, and is experienced in sales. 

One of her greatesting advantages in dealing with competition is her friendliness with the people who visit her stand. She already has a large clientele, as people prefer her because of the quality of the product she sells and the good prices; but especially for the unmatched service.

María is a woman very dedicated to her work; always ready to do her utmost to succeed. She is aware that she will achieve success only through motivation and perseverance. She is very motivated, and says that in this sales season her earnings will increase. 

She wants to invest in more product, but needs working capital. That is why she is applying to Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy shoes at wholesale. 

María Magdalena has good payment references and an impeccable moral character. She says she will be able to repay the loan, and at the same time provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy shoes at wholesale.

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es: La señora Cirila  es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajo desde muy jovencita, cuando se casó con el papá de sus hijos ella implemento un taller de confecciones en su casa para poder ayudar a la manutención de sus hijos, ya que su esposo es músico y solo trabaja eventualmente. Cirila confecciona unos mandiles de tela (típicos de la región) que ella misma los vende en las ferias y mercados que hay por su localidad. Cirila utilizará el préstamo recibido en la compra de telas, hilos, botones y otros; para poder aumentar la  producción en la confección de sus prendas y así generar mayores ingresos mejorando la calidad de vida de su hogar. Cirila,  en la fotografía, es la segunda de la derecha viste una chompa de lana negro, pantalón de color negro. * En la parte superior se encuentra Christian .
texts.en:
Cirila is a hardworking, tenacious woman who has worked since she was very young.  When she married the father of her children she set up a sewing shop at home to help feed her children since her husband’s a musician and only works occasionally.

Cirila makes cloth aprons (typical of the region) that she sells herself in street fairs and markets around her community.  Cirila will use the received loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons and others to increase production of items thus generating higher income and improving her home’s quality of life.  

In the photo, Cirila is second from the right wearing a black wool jacket and black pants.

*Christian appears at the top of the photo.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: La Sra. Georgina  es soltera, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Trabajando para el Futuro” grupo  conformado por 6 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Georgina trabaja desde hace 16  años en la venta de abarrotes y condimentos al por mayor, este negocio surge porque ella quería ayudar a sus padres a tener una mejor calidad de vida ya que ella no tiene hijos, se hizo de un capital e invirtió en abarrotes con el tiempo su negocio fue creciendo y empezó a vender al por mayor condimentos (ají molido, ajo molido, pimienta en polvo etc.) ,con el tiempo se hizo muy conocida ahora cuenta con mayor clientela, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, ha construido su casa, y su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería insumos, abarrotes leche, fideos,arroz etc Georgina cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Georgina is single and currently a member of the “Trabajando para el Futuro” (Working for the Future) communal bank, a group composed of six members who carry out a variety of commercial activities.

Georgina has worked for the last 16 years selling groceries and condiments at wholesale.  This business arose because she wanted to help her parents have a better quality of life since she has no children.  She got some capital and invested in groceries and in time her business grew and she started to sell condiments at wholesale (ground chili, ground garlic, powdered pepper, etc.).  She became very well known in time and now she has a large clientele.  Thanks to her efforts and dedication she’s managed to earn higher income, has built her house and her family has a better quality of life.

With the goal of continuing to grow, she’s asking for a new loan to buy merchandise, groceries, milk, noodles, rice, etc.  Edaprospo believes that Georgina will reach her goals with much work and effort and that Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Genesis Michelle

texts.es: Génesis tiene 23 años y es madre soltera de un niño de 2 años. Vive en Duran con sus padres en una casa familiar de cemento contando con todos los servicios básicos. Génesis se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo. Esta joven empresaria nos comenta que su negocio lo empezó con la ayuda de una amiga quien la ayudo con la inscripción. Luego de esto se propuso aprender como era el manejo del negocio ya que quería ganar dinero en aquel entonces para su parto. Ahora ya conoce y se mueve bien en el mismo, ella nos comenta que la forma de ver verdaderas ganancias, para ella, no es vender el producto directamente sino tener su red de ventas. Una red es cuando hay una persona principal quien maneja los pedidos, la entrega y el pago de manera general y gana por cada una de las personas que tiene en su red, es decir bajo su código con lo que gana por volumen. En la actualidad tiene 30 personas en su red con lo que le genera muchas ganancias, esto también tiene la ventaja de que trata muy poco con el cliente final reduciendo sus riesgos de personas que no le paguen.  Génesis nos comenta que no tiene horario ya que está disponible cuando le hacen pedidos para no quedar mal con sus vendedoras. También vende los que es perfumes, cremas,maquillaje a familiares y conocidos previo pedidos. El crédito lo comprar para tener productos en stock y a la vez un capital para realizar los pagos de manera oportuna. Su sueño próximo es convertirse en líder de ventas con un mayor número de integrantes en su grupo.
texts.en:
Génesis is 23 years old and the single mother of a 2-year-old child.  She lives in Duran with her parents, in a family home which is made from cement and has all basic services.  Génesis' business is selling cosmetics through a catalog.  This entrepreneurial young woman tells us that she started her business with the support of a friend who helped her with the registration.  She then set out to learn how to manage her business because, back then, she wanted to earn money for when she gave birth.  Now she knows her business and is doing well in it.

Génesis tells us that the way to make real profits, for her, is not to sell products directly but rather to have a sales network.  A network is when there is one main person who manages the orders, deliveries and payment.  They earn money for every member they have in their network.  Génesis currently has 30 people in her network which makes her a lot of profits.  It also has the advantage that she has very little contact with the end customer which reduces her risk of having to deal with people who don't pay.  Génesis tells us that she doesn't work fixed hours as she is available whenever people make orders so that she doesn't let her saleswomen down.  She also sells perfumes, creams and makeup to family members and acquaintances to order.  She will use her loan to buy products to have in stock.  She will have capital available so that she can make her payments in a timely fashion.  Her next dream is to become a sales leader with a larger number of members in her group.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and makeup

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
В 2011 году Ирина брала кредит КИВА с целью привлечения дополнительных денежных средств для расширения ассортимента. Особых изменений в направлении бизнеса не наблюдалось: пока Ирина продолжает арендовать помещение под бизнес на одном из местных рынков города Запорожья. Несмотря на то, что в прошлом году стало заметно, что хуже стала покупательская способность, Ирина все же продолжала работать с индивидуальными клиентами, которые заказывают товар оптом.  
Ирине необходим кредит в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести метизы, гипсокартон и другие стройматерилы. Лето – это всегда пора ремонтов, клиенты хорошо берут разные стройматериалы.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Irina obtained a loan from Kiva in 2011 to attract additional finances and expand her merchandise selection.  Since then, no major changes in business direction have been observed.  Irina continues to lease a space for her business at one of the local markets in the city of Zaporozhye.  Despite the fact that last year it was noticed that consumer confidence decreased, Irina continued to work with individual clients, who ordered merchandise wholesale.  Irina needs a loan in the amount of 15 000 hryvnia to purchase hardware, drywall and other construction materials.  Summer is always the time for repairs, and clients purchase various construction materials well.

loans.use: to purchase hardware, drywall and other construction materials

loans.name: Los Rosales De Huascata Group

texts.es: La Sra. Yulisa, tiene 3 hijos  es casada, Yulisa  es integrante de la alcancia comunal “Los Rosales de Huascata”, grupo conformado por 7 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Yulisa  trabaja vendiendo prendas de vestir a domicilio desde hace tres años, Yulisa inicia este negocio con el fin de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y educacion de sus hijos, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a  logrado mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, brindándoles educación  y con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería prendas de vestir ( pantalon, polos etc) . Yulisa  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Yulisa has three children and is married.  She’s a member of the “Los Rosales de Huascata” communal bank, a group of seven members who carry out a variety of commercial activities. ‘

Yulisa works selling clothing door to door; she’s been in business three years.  She started the business in order to help her husband cover household expenses and her children’s educational costs.  Thanks to her effort and dedication she succeeded in improving her children’s quality of life providing schooling for them.

In order to continue growing she’s asking for a new loan to buy clothing (pants, shirts, etc.).  Edaprospo believes that Yulisa will reach her goals with effort and much work and that Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es: Raymundo es una persona  muy humilde y trabajadora, quien vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos quienes le ayudan con el negocio a Raymundo. Él es muy responsable y comprometido por el bienestar de su familia, por lo que trabaja muy arduamente por brindarles todo lo mejor a su esposa e hijos. Raymundo se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijoles en su propio terreno, los cuales posteriormente con la ayuda de su esposa  comercializan en centros de ventas por mayoreo de granos básicos y mercados. Con el enorme deseo de aumentar sus ventas, Raymundo solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y de esta forma contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de semillas, pesticidas, abono, compartimientos y todo lo necesario para realizar su siembra y mantener la frescura de sus productos, brindando como siempre el mejor servicio posible.
texts.en: Raymundo is a very humble and hard working person. He lives with his wife and three children, who help him with his business. He is very responsible and committed to the well-being of his family, which is why he works so hard to provide the best for his wife and children. Raymundo makes a living planting corn and beans on his own land; which with the help of his wife, he later sells in basic grain wholesale centers and markets. With the great desire he has to increase his sales, Raymundo requested a loan through the communal bank, "Integral", which will allow him to have the funds he needs to invest in seeds, pesticides, fertilizer, storage containers, and all other necessary supplies to be able to plant and keep his products fresh, providing, as always, the best service possible.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to plant and harvest corn and beans.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es: Don José Medardo es casado con 4 hijos, algunos de sus hijos son estudiantes y dependen de el, su esposa se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa nueva. Anteriormente don José trabajaba como maestro de educación primaria y por problemas de salud tuvo que dejar su trabajo, siendo que el no quería ser una carga para su familia decidió poner una chiclera en el parque de la comunidad. El préstamo que don José solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de todo tipo de dulces, chicles, chocolates, galletas, confites, etc. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá surtir su chiclera y seguir aportando para la alimentación, educación y salud de sus hijos. Los ingresos de don José no son muchos, así que su mayor deseo es el de aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar. Don José es cliente de FAMA desde hace varios ciclos y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
José Medardo is married and has four children.  His children are students and depend on him.  His wife sells shoes and new clothes.  

José used to work as an elementary school teacher but due to health problems had to leave his job.  Because he didn’t want to be a burden to his family, he decided to open a gum stand in the local park.  He’s asking for a loan to buy what he needs: all types of candy, gum, chocolates, cookies, snacks, etc.  

With support from this loan he will be able to stock his stand and continue to contribute towards his children’s food, schooling and health.  José’s income isn’t high so his greatest wish is to increase profits so that his home’s economy will improve.  José has been a FAMA client for several cycles and has made his installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy sweets, gum, chocolates, cookies, candies, etc.

loans.name: Dolores Idalia

texts.es: Dolores Idalia de 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Ella es una mujer muy dedicada y trabajadora, quien siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante junto a su compañero de vida. Dolores comercializa joyas de oro y de plata, las cuales ha vendido durante 26 años, ella es muy conocida en la zona ya que siempre ha brindado productos de primera calidad y así mismo ofrece muy buenos precios. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de variedad de joyas como cadenas, aritos, pulseras y anillos, y más. El principal propósito de Dolores es mejorar sus ventas y así brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo de manera que puedan contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Dolores Idalia is 45, and lives with her husband and children. She is a very hard-working and dedicated woman who has always done her best so that she and her life companion can move forward in life. 

Dolores sells gold and silver jewelry, which she has done for 26 years. She is very well-known in the area, as she has always provided top-quality products and also offers very good prices. 

She is applying for a loan that will enable her to have the money necessary to invest in the purchase of a variety of jewelry, such as chains, earrings, bracelets, rings and more. 

Dolores' principal aim is to improve her sales and provide her husband with all help he needs, so that they can have a better life.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Belgica

texts.es:
Con 42,000 pesos Belgica podrá comprar mercancía para aumentar el inventario de su tiendecita. Hace cuatro años que Bélgica abrió su tiendecita como una manera de no estar todo el día en casa, ya que su esposo prefería que ella se quedara en casa cuidando a los niños. Así que ella abría la tienda en las mañanas, mientras los niños estaban en la escuela y en las tardes se quedaba en casa cuidándoles. 
Nunca imaginó que esta tienda sería el medio de sustento para su familia. Belgica enviudó de manera repentina hace un año, cuando su esposo murió en un accidente. Belgica tiene tres hijos de 9, 7 y cuatro años, además está criando a un hijo de su esposo de 16 años.
Este cambio repentino no ha sido fácil para Bélgica, pero con el apoyo y oración de su familia y amigos ha salido adelante.
texts.en:
With 42,000 pesos, Bélgica will be able to purchase merchandise to increase her little store's inventory. Four years ago Bélgica opened her store as a way to avoid being in the house all day since her husband wanted her to stay home and care for the children. So she opened the store in the mornings while the children were in school and in the afternoons she stayed at home to care for them. 

She never imagined that the store would become a source of support for her family. A year ago Bélgica was widowed all of a sudden when her husband was killed in an accident. Bélgica has three children who are 9, 7, and 4 years old in addition to raising a child of her husband's who is 16 years old. This sudden change has not been easy for Bélgica but with the support and prayers of her family and friends, she has gotten ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her little store.

loans.name: Maria Oralia

texts.es:
Maria se encuentra casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, a quien siempre le ha querido brindar todo lo necesario; es por esto que desde que quedó embarazada Maria dejó su trabajo en una empresa donde consideraba que no le pagaban lo justo por su trabajo y decidió montar su propio negocio para progresar económicamente. Fue así como montó una venta de productos de uso personal y ropa donde sus principales clientes son sus familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector, y gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida en su hogar ha mejorado considerablemente, y a su hijo de 2 años le ha podido brindar todo lo necesario. Gracias a que sus ventas son muy buenas, y debido a que se acerca la temporada donde sus ventas aumentan considerablemente, Maria requiere un préstamo para comprar ropa y productos de uso personal para tener un buen inventario en la temporada.

De esta manera podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y así seguir generando ingresos para su hogar con lo que tendrá la oportunidad de tener en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
María is married and has a two-year-old son for whom she always wants to provide everything necessary which is why since she got pregnant María left her job in a firm where she felt she wasn’t paid a fair salary for her work and decided to start her own business to progress economically.

This is how she started to sell personal use items and clothes.  Her main customers are family members, friends and neighbors in the area.  Thanks to this business the quality of life in her home has improved considerably since she’s been able to provide for all her two-year-old son’s needs.

Because her sales are good and the season when sales increase considerably is approaching, María needs a loan to buy clothes and personal use items in order to have a good inventory available for the season.  In this way she will be able to meet customer demand and continue generating income for her home that will give her the opportunity of having a better quality of life at home and better opportunities for economic progress.

loans.use: to buy clothes and personal use items.

loans.name: Maria Estella

texts.es:
Maria se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos, y con el ánimo de contribuir económicamente en su hogar para tener una mejor calidad de vida, tiene un taller de confección donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros. Desde muy joven le interesó la actividad, y gracias a que tenía cerca algunas personas que se dedicaban a esta actividad, aprendió rápidamente y comenzó a trabajar con esto. En un principio solo arreglaba algunas cosas de su casa y fabricaba algunas prendas para su hogar, pero poco a poco le fue llegando personas al taller pidiendo el servicio de confeccionarles algo. Posteriormente pasó a trabajar con una empresa de confección y fue así como inició de lleno el servicio de confección a terceros trabajando grandes cantidades para una empresa. Poco a poco su taller viene creciendo cada vez más y comenzó a comprar máquinas para aumentar la capacidad de producción y así cada vez sus pedidos se incrementaban; actualmente tiene un gran pedido por parte de un cliente y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital para su negocio, requiere de un préstamo que le permita comprar telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos que requiere para la fabricación de un gran pedido.

De esta manera logrará superar esta dificultad de capital en su negocio y esto le permitirá tener mejores oportunidades para seguir creciendo. Además, poco a poco irán creciendo sus ingresos de modo que en su hogar tendrán una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Su mayor sueño es brindarle la posibilidad a otras personas de que inicien con su propio negocio enseñándoles la actividad para que progresen económicamente.
texts.en:
María is married and has two children.  Aiming to contribute economically to her home in order to have a better quality of life, she has a sewing shop where she sews for third parties.  She became interested in this activity while still very young and thanks to having people in this activity nearby she  learned quicklyand started working at it.  

At the beginning, she only did repairs at home and made a few items for her home but gradually people started coming by her workshop asking her to make things for them.  Later on she started working for a clothes making firm and that’s how she started to work full-time providing sewing services for third parties producing large quantities for a firm.  Gradually her workshop has been growing more each time and she started to buy machines to increase production; her orders have increased more each time.  She currently has a large pending order for a customer and because she does not have much capital in her business she needs a loan to be able to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other supplies she needs to fill this large order.

In this way she’ll manage to overcome this difficulty of business capital that will permit her to have better opportunities for continued growth.  Also, income will gradually increase such that her home will have a better quality of life and improved economic stability.  Her greatest dream is to provide other people with the opportunity of having their own business teaching them this activity so that they can make economic progress.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary, a hardworking woman living in Kagadi, Uganda, has been operating a retail shop for a period of four years. She started with capital from agriculture, a field in which she worked for a long period. Rosemary says inadequate capital is affecting her business and is now requesting a loan to buy sugar and salt to sell.

Rosemary would like to educate her children and buy land to grow crops.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Undraga

texts.en: Undraga, 34, lives with her husband and her three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband runs a taxi service. Two of her children are secondary school students and the younger one stays at home. She started her building materials retail business on a rental counter in the local market in 2002. Her business is sustainable and has many regular costumers and suppliers. In the winter, air pollution is one of the biggest problems facing the Mongolian government. Her home is at a dangerous level of air quality in Ulaanbaatar. Therefore, she wants to buy land without pollution for her children's future. She says, "my children's health is very important to me" She is requesting 4,000,000 MNT to buy land located in an area with low pollution.

loans.use: To buy land located in an area with low pollution

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Con 21,000 pesos Antonia podrá comprar mercancía para aumentar el inventario de su tienda de comestibles. Hace 8 años que Antonia quedó viuda, siempre había sido amada de casa. Entonces tenía cincuenta años y comprendió que a esa edad se le haría muy dificil obtener un empleo por primera vez, así que decidió abrir su propio necogio y no se puede quejar, aunque ha pasado por tiempos difíciles, sus vecinos le han apoyado para que su tienda de comestibles salga adelante.
Antonia tiene 6 hijos, el mayor tiene 40 y el menor 17. Ya todos se han casado, excepto el menor, que aún vive con ella. Está en la secundaria y le ayuda en las tardes en la tienda (He).
Antonia quiere en el futuro poder construir su tienda de block, ya que en este momento es de madera, para así tener un lugar más duradero y seguro donde almacenar su mercancía
texts.en:
With 21,000 pesos, Antonia will be able to purchase merchandise to increase her small grocery store's inventory.  

Eight years ago Antonia was widowed and had previously always been a housewife. She was 50 years old then and she understood that at that age it would be very hard for her to find employment for the first time. That is why she decided to open her own business and she can't complain. Although she has had some difficult times, her neighbors have helped her so that her grocery store has progressed. 

Antonia has six children; the oldest is 40 and the youngest is 17. All of them have married, save for the youngest who still lives with her. Her youngest is also in high school and helps her at the store in the afternoons. 

In the future Antonio wants to build a cinder block store because the one she has now is made of wood. This would be a more durable and safe place to store her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Patricia Lastenia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 28 años de edad y vive en Isla Trinitaria sector sur urbano de Guayaquil. Vive en la casa de sus padres ya que es madre soltera de 1 niño y ellos le ayudan con su cuidado. Hace 4 años 4 meses decidió abrir un pequeño bazar con el que cubriría sus gastos. Patricia nos cuenta que empezó solo con una mesa que colocaba afuera de su casa mostrando sus productos que consistían en cuadernos, papelería, lápices. Poco a poco fue haciéndose conocer con lo que empezó a surtir los productos que vendía. Patricia nos comenta que le gusta mucho el comercio e interactuar con las personas. Ahora tiene un local en su casa y con el anterior crédito que solcito compro una vitrina donde expone sus artículos. Vende peluches, vestidos de niña, papel de regalo, perfumes, crema, helados, colas, confetis etc. Patricia nos comenta que todo su esfuerzo es por su hijo quien estudia en la escuela a quien le quiere brindar toda la protección que pueda. Con el crédito comprar mercadería para surtir el negocio esperando agrandarlo en un futuro.
texts.en:
Patricia, age 28, lives in the Isla Trinitaria sector of south urban Guayaquil.  She lives in her parents’ house because she is the single mother of a one year old child.  They help her take care of her son.

Four years and four months ago she decided to open a small store, which would cover her expenses.  Patricia tells us that she started with only one table placed outside of her house.  That is where she displayed her products, which are notebooks, stationery items, and paper.  Little by little she was becoming known, and she started to stock the products that she sold.

Patricia tells us that she really likes the business and interacting with people.  She now has a place in her house, and with the previous loan she bought a display case where she shows her goods.  She sells stuffed animals, children’s clothes, gift wrapping paper, perfume, creams, ice cream, soda, and candy, etc.

Patricia tells us that all of her effort is for her son, who goes to school.  She wants to give him all of the security that she can.  

She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her business, hoping to expand it in the future.

loans.use: to buy stuffed animals, pencils, notebooks, paper, perfume, creams, and ice cream.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
За счет последнего кредита от КИВА Наталия смогла разнообразить ассортимент товара, который она представляет в своем магазинчике. Дополнительная партия товара хорошо разошлась и Наталия получила на 1 000 гривен больше дохода, чем обычно. 
Наталия снова обратилась в КИВА за кредитом в размере 15 000 гривен, чтобы закупить новые виды парфюмерной продукции и обновить свой старый ассортимент. Наталия знает, что многое зависит от качества предлагаемого товара и наличия самых разных брендов и опций – это всегда привлекает потенциальных покупателей. Поэтому она надеется, что дополнительные средства посодействуют ей в этом процессе привлечения новых клиентов, торговля вырастет еще больше и доход будет продолжать увеличиваться. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva, Nataliya was able to increase the variety of merchandise she has for sale. Those goods sold very well and Nataliya profited 1000 grivnas more than usual. 

She's asking for another loan of 15,000 grivnas in order to purchase some new perfume products and increase the assortment of items she has for sale. Nataliya's business depends on the quality of her goods as well as the variety of different brands and labels she has to offer. 
She hopes that this loan will assist her in attracting new customers and increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of perfume products and increase the variety of merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 32-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been operating a general store for the past three years. A lack of goods to meet his customers’ high-volume demands is his main challenge.

Moses is applying for a 2,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy general merchandise such as sugar and soap to sell. His ambitions include moving his store to a more permanent location, running a wholesale shop and building his own house.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Mamadoudiawara Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 28 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Mai 2010. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfant (02 garçons et 01 fille).

Elle achète et vend des produits alimentaires comme l’aile, l’huile …, une activité qu’elle fait depuis 2 ans.
Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en au niveau des grossistes de la place en huile, aile et autres produits alimentaire pour revendre en détaille dans son quartier.
-	Pour un sac de sucre de 24 000F Cfa elle revend à 30 000F Cfa
-	Pour un bidon de 20 litres d’huile à 14 500F Cfa elle revend à 19 000f Cfa
-	Pour un carton d’aile de 5 kg à 2 700F Cfa elle revend à 6 000F Cfa
-	Pour un sac d’oignon à 8 000F Cfa elle revend à 14 000F Cfa
Apres vente et déduction des frais de transport elle se retrouve avec un bénéfice net hebdomadaire de 15 000F Cfa. 

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et de prendre en charge une partie de la dépense quotidienne et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 28 women who are very active in their village bank which was created in May 2010.  The women are all from the same neighborhood and have a good understanding between them.  Their main activity is small business.

Fatou (sitting on the far right with her right hand raised) is the featured borrower for this group.  She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of three children (two sons and one daughter).

Fatou buys and sells food products such as garlic, oil, etc.  She has been in this business for two years.  With this loan, she will stock up with oil, garlic and other food products from local wholesalers and then re-sell them in her neighborhood.  She will buy the following:

One sack of sugar at 24,000 francs, which she will re-sell for 30,000 francs.
One 20 liter container of oil for 14,500 francs, which she will re-sell for 19,000 francs.
One 5kg box of garlic for 2,700 francs, which she will re-sell for 6,000 francs.
A sack of onions for 8,000 francs, which she will re-sell for 14,000 francs.

After selling her products and subtracting her transportation expenses, Fatou makes a net weekly profit of 15,000 francs.  The profits she makes in her business will allow her to save and take care of some of her daily expenses and her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to stock up with oil, garlic and other food products from local wholesalers so that she can later sell them retail in her neighborhood

loans.name: Quiterio Eudoro

texts.es: Quiterio tiene 26 años y vive en Manta. Vive en una casa de su propiedad de construcción de ladrillo contando con los servicios básicos. Quiterio está casado con Yisela quien es obrera en una empresa pesquera y tienen 2 hijos de 6 y 1 año de edad. El negocio que tiene es de producción ya que se dedica al proceso de la pepa de Tagua. Empezó por iniciativa de un vecino quien se dedica a esta actividad y le iba bien, él fue quien le enseño el negocio informándole que el éxito está en el volumen que maneje. Al principio tenía sus dudas ya que era algo nuevo pero poco a poco fue ganando confianza así como clientes. Lleva 6 años en el negocio y ha crecido paulatinamente. Recuerda que al principio no tenia las herramientas para el manejo de la pepa de tagua pero en la actualidad tiene maquinas que le facilitan el proceso, el proceso es la recolección, el pelado, la forma que se le dé y el secado. Quiterio se dedica a la venta por mayor y menor, en la foto aparecen los sacos del material para su proceso convirtiendo la pepa en botones y figuras artesanales de animales. Como este negocio es su fuente de ingreso lo realiza solo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. La mayoría de sus clientes son los pequeños vendedores de la cuidad quienes ofertan los productos como recuerdos a los turistas en las playas de Manta. El mayor contratiempo que tiene es en la época de invierno ya que las calles de su negocio no están pavimentadas y dificultan la entrega del producto. Con el crédito que solicita Quiterio aumentara su producción con la compra de pepas de tagua para  la producción esperando reunir el capital necesario para la compra de otra máquina.
texts.en:
Quiterio, 26, lives in Manta in a brick house he owns; it has basic utilities.  Quiterio is married to Yisela who works for a fish processing plant; they have two children who are 6 years old and 1 year old.  

He works in production in that he processes Tagua [vegetable ivory] pits.  He started out motivated by a neighbor who also works in this activity and did well.  He taught him the business and told him that success depended on the volume he could handle.  

At the beginning he had his doubts because it was something new for him but gradually he gained more confidence and customers.  He’s been in business six years and it’s been growing step by step.  He recalls that at first he did not have the tools to handle the Tagua pits but he now has machines that make the process easier.  The process consists in collecting, peeling, shaping and drying.


Quiterio sells at wholesale and retail. In the photo sacks of material appear that will be used to convert the pits into buttons and artisanal animal figurines.  Because this business is his source of income he works at it only from 7am until 5pm.  Most of his customers are small vendors in the city who sell the products as souvenirs to tourists at the beaches in Manta.  His greatest obstacle is during the winter because streets around his business are unpaved and product delivery is difficult.

With the loan he’s requesting, Quiterio will increase production with the purchase of tagua pits for production hoping to gather the necessary capital to buy an additional machine.

loans.use: to buy tagua [plant known as plant ivory] pits.

loans.name: Yana

texts.ru: Яна не замужем. Она работает бугалтером в городской типографии, получает стабильную зарплату. Яна получила квартиру в наследство. Но жилье нуждается в ремонте. Яна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 8000 гривен на косметический ремонт в квартире и замену сантехники.
texts.en: Yana is single. She works as an accountant in her city's printing office and earns a regular salary. Yana inherited a flat but it's in need of repair. So she's asking for a loan of 8000 grivnas to renovate her home and purchase some new bathroom fixtures.

loans.use: improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Yanires

texts.es:
Con 8,480 pesos Yanires podrá comprar productos para el cuidado del cabaello para usarlos en sus clientes en su salón de belleza. Desde niña Yanires jugaba con sus muñecas maquillandolas y peinándolas, cuando fue creciendo fue cambiando las muñecas por sus amiguitas. Hace tres años se animó a abrir su propio salón de belleza en un área de la sala de su casa, luego de haber trabajado por varios años como empleada en otros salones de belleza.
Yanires es madre soltera, tiene dos niños un varón de 7 y una hembra de tres años. El varon ya asiste a la escuela, y la  niña se queda en casa con mami.
Ella sueña con un salón de belleza grande en una plaza comercial (mall).
texts.en:
With 8,480 pesos, Yanires will be able to buy hair care products to use with clients at her beauty salon. 

Since she was a child, Yanires played with dolls, putting make up on them and fixing their hair. When she grew up she moved on from dolls to friends. Three years ago, after working for several years as an employee in other beauty salons, she was ready to open her own salon in a section of the living room in her house.

Yanires is a single mother and has two children. One is a boy of seven and the other in a three-year-old girl. The boy goes to school already and the little girl stays at home with mom. 

Her dream is to have a large salon in a mall.

loans.use: to buy products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Walter Gilbert

texts.es: Walter vive en Libertad con sus padres en la casa familiar. A sus 45 años se dedica a la sastrería en un local de su propiedad. Al principio quien se dedicaba a esto era su hermana quien tiene un taller muy conocido en el sector contando con un excelente número de clientes. Fue ella quien al principio le enseño el negocio, después por decisión propia tomo varios cursos para aprender las técnicas de la costura. Descubrió que le gusta mucho esta actividad por lo que decidió ampliar el taller de su hermana. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita, el primero lo utilizo en la compra de una máquina de coser teniendo en buen esta crediticio. El negocio no lo atiende solo ya que su hermana le ayuda con los clientes trabajando de lunes a domingo todo el día, esto se debe que tienen mucha demanda sobre todo en la época escolar donde realizan uniformes. Sus principales clientes son los colegios quienes envían la producción de equipos en serie, también personas particulares. Es crédito que solicita lo empleara en la compra de telas, hilos, botones y cierres para la producción. Walter desea a futuro incrementar sus ventas y poder comprar una casa propia.
texts.en: Walter lives with his parents in the family home in Libertad. Aged 45, he works as a tailor in his own premises. Initially, the business belonged to his sister, who had a well-known workshop frequented by a great number of customers. It was she who first taught him the ropes of the business; later he decided to take some courses to learn about sewing techniques. He discovered that he quite enjoyed sewing, so he decided to expand his sister's workshop. This is the second loan that he has applied for; the first loan was invested in buying a sewing machine. He does not work alone in the business as his sister helps him serve the customers; they work all day from Monday to Sunday as they have a high demand to satisfy, especially during school term times when they manufacture uniforms. His main customers are the schools who request bulk orders of uniforms, as well as private individuals.This particular loan will be used to buy fabrics, threads, buttons and closures for use in his production. Walter hopes that in the future he will increase his sales and be able to buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, buttons and closures.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
From Kyenjojo, Uganda, Margret is a 35-year-old married woman with three children. For the past five years she has sold shoes for a living. Problems of inadequate capital to buy more shoes, price fluctuations and inflation leading to high operational costs challenge her.

Margret is applying for a 2,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy more shoes to sell. Her ambition is to educate her children, build herself a house and expand her sales into new marketplaces.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es: La Sra. Baseliza de 68 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya no dependen de ella. Tiene más de 6 años como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de licores y cerveza desde hace  10 años. También se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 12 años. Comenzó con la idea de incrementar su ingreso y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado construir su casa y dar estudio a sus hijos. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de agua y luz mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos de alimentación. Su plan para el futuro es abrir una bodega o bazar en su propio domicilio y seguir mejorando su estilo de vida. Ella usó el préstamo en la compra de productos de belleza para su negocio. Baseliza pertenece a la alcancía comunal “El Buen Samaritano”, nombre que le pusieron por la bondad y la fe que existe en cada socia. El grupo esta conformado por 9 personas y Baseliza ocupa el cargo de presidenta desde hace 1 año.
texts.en: Baseliza is 68 years old; she is married with 4 children, none of whom are dependent on her. She has been an Edaprospo client for 6 years and she has been running a business selling beers and spirits for 10 years. She has also been selling cosmetics for 12 years, which she started doing with the aim of increasing her income and improving her family's standard of living. Owing to her hard work and commitment, she has succeeded in building her own home and educating her children. Her plan for the future is to open a shop or a stall in her own home and continue to improve their way of life. Currently, her income covers the bills for water and lights while her husband covers their food expenses. This loan will be used to buy beauty products for her business. Baseliza belongs to the "Good Samaritan" Communal Bank, a name which was chosen because of the kindness and faith of each of its members. The group is made up of 9 people and Baseliza has occupied the role of president for the last year.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business.

loans.name: Zulfi

texts.ru: Зулфи проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ей 59 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее сын работает в МЗО "Хумо и Партнеры". Она сама занимается садоводством и растениеводством. Этим видом деятельности она занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
