Ayda want to help her daughter continue her studies, so she has applied for this educational loan in order to pay for her daughter’s school semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s school semester fees

loans.name: María Catalina

texts.es: María catalina de 53 años, vive con sus dos hijos mayores de edad que le ayudan a ella en los oficios del hogar, viven en casa propia muy humilde. María es una persona trabajadora que con esfuerzo a llevado a sus hijos adelante y a tratado de ser la mejor madre para ellos. Actualmente tiene un puesto de tortillas en su casa, gracias a Dios por su forma y manera de ser posee abundante clientela, aunque últimamente a sufrido varios percances con la plancha porque necesita pintura y lijarla para que no tenga mal apariencia a la hora de vender las tortillas, también con el  maíz ya que ha subido de precio y necesita comprar insumos como volteadores, manteca, aceite. Es por eso que ha solicitado a INTEGRAL un préstamo para comprar estos insumos comprando maíz al costo y mantener la clientela obteniendo ganancias y mejorando precio a manera que le resulten las ventas y pueda pagar el préstamo antes de lo acordado.
texts.en:
Maria Catalina is 53 years old and lives with her two adult children who help her with the duties of the household in the modest home that they own.   Maria is a hard worker who labored to help her children be successful and has tried to be the best mother possible to them.  

Now, she has a tortilla stand in her house. Thanks to God, her hard work and her personality, has many customers.  Although, recently she has suffered various setbacks with the cooking iron because it needs to be sanded and painted so it doesn't have a bad appearance when she is selling tortillas.  Also, the price of corn has risen and she needs to buy supplies such as spatulas, lard, and oil.  

She has applied for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy these supplies, to buy corn at wholesale price, and to maintain her customers.  This will allow her to make a profit and to improve the price to increase sales as well as to be able to repay the loan early.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn, lime, and propane gas.

loans.name: Jesus Feliciano

texts.es: Jesús vive en el norte de Guayaquil en la urbanización conocida como las Orquídeas. Tiene 57 años y vive con su esposa Cruz quien es ama de casa. A su cuidado tiene un hijo de 13 años quien estudia en la escuela fiscal del sector. Jesús realiza dos actividades para poder cubrir sus gastos, antes trabajaba en una empresa como obrero pero termino su contrato y con la liquidación que recibió inicio su depósito de venta de colas. La venta la realiza por la ventana de su casa en donde tiene ubicada su nevera y realiza la venta de colas, agua y jugos. Atiende el negocio de lunes a domingos sin horario fijo ya que también hace carreras como taxista en su carro. El negocio no lo cierra cuando hace carreras ya que su esposa le ayuda con la atención. Su mayor preocupación es que se le presente alguna enfermedad grave y que no pueda trabajar ya que es el único sustento de su familia. Con el crédito va a comprar mercaderías para tener en stock en su depósito, con esto espera agrandar el negocio y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Jesús lives in the north of Guayaquil in the housing development known as Las Orquídeas. He is 57 years old and lives with his wife Cruz who is a housewife. He has a 13 year old son under his care who studies in the local state school. 

Jesús undertakes two activities to be able to cover their costs. Beforehand he was a company worker but his contract finished and with the redundancy pay he received, he set up his drinks store. He sells products through the window of his home where his has set up his freezer and he sells cola, water and juices. He mans the business seven days a week without fixed working hours as he also makes journeys as a taxi driver in his car. The business doesn't close when he goes out on these journeys as his wife helps him serve customers. 

His greatest concern is that he will fall seriously ill and no longer be able to work as this is the only form of income for his family. Using the loan, he will buy merchandise to stock his store, and in this way, he hopes to expand the business and continue progressing.

loans.use: to buy cola, water and juices.

loans.name: Egda Cecilia

texts.es: Egda nació en Quevedo hace 35 años, vive en una casa propia de cemento que cuenta con todos servicios básicos. Como la casa es propia la modifico para poder abrir un local en la parte delantera de la misma. El local lo inicio hace 14 años empezando como una heladería, con el pasar los años y gracias a varios créditos solicitados su negocio tiene muy buen aspecto. Compro varias vitrinas para exponer los artículos, una nevera para la venta de gaseosas, yogurt así como repisas. En la actualidad tiene un bazar muy surtido el cual atiende todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Los productos que vende son peluches, cuadernos, láminas, perfumes, colas, snack. Su esposo le ayuda con la atención o con la compra de los artículos cuando no puede, es de gran ayuda y apoyo en todas las decisiones que toma. Con el crédito comprara productos para surtir el negocio esperando aumentarlo, a futuro ella desea abrir una almacén donde vendería artículos del hogar a crédito.
texts.en:
Egda was born in Quevedo 35 years ago.  She lives in her own cement house that has all basic utilities.  Since the house is hers she modified it in order to install a store in the front part of it.  

She started the store 14 years ago as an ice-cream shop and as time has gone by and thanks to various loans requested it has a very pleasant appearance.  She bought several display cases to display her wares, a refrigerator for her soft-drink sales, yoghurt and shelving.  

She currently has a very sell-stocked general store where she takes care of customers from 8am until 7pm daily.  The products she sells are stuffed toys, notebooks, laminated sheets, perfume, sodas and snacks.  Her husband helps her take care of customers or buying items when she can’t; he’s a great help and support in all the decisions she makes.  

She will use the loan to buy products to stock her store hoping to expand it.  In future she’d like to open a warehouse to sell items for the home on credit.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Monica Rosario

texts.es: En la ciudad de Milagros vive Mónica, tiene 42 años y se dedica al comercio. Vive en una casa de su propiedad la cual adquirió hace 6 años y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. La casa le sirve como bodega ya que ella vende la mercadería en un puesto fijo ubicado en el centro donde todos los días pone su negocio. Mónica indica estar habituada a esta forma de trabajo ya que empezó a los 18 años pero lo hacía recorriendo diversos sectores hasta que consiguió un puesto fijo. Trabaja de lunes a domingos sin descanso porque es madre soltera y necesita cubrir sus necesidades. En su puesto vende pantalones unisex, camisas, pantalonetas, blusas, interiores, todo lo compra en serie al mayor y vende unitariamente. Como el puesto de Mónica es informal el problema se le presenta en la época de invierno donde las lluvias enlodan las calles y las deterioran. El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de ropa para la venta, ella espera poder reunir algo de capital para abrir un local en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Mónica is a 42-year-old merchant living in the city of Milagros. She lives in her own home, which she purchased 6 years ago.  She has all of the basic utilities in her home.  Her house serves as a storage space for her merchandise, since every day she goes to her stall located in the city center to sell her goods.

She says that she is used to this type of work since she started doing it at age 18. However, she worked in many different areas until she was able to have her permanent location.  She works seven days a week without rest because she is a single mother and needs to cover her basic necessities.  In her store she sells shirts, blouses, unisex pants, shorts and underwear.  She buys these wholesale and resells them to consumers.

As her store location is outdoors, the winters are problematic since the rains flood the streets and cause deterioration.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase clothes for resale.  She hopes to be able to put together enough capital to have a store based in her home.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, unisex pants, and shorts.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, age 34, is a barber. He lives with his wife in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been operating his business for a period of four years.

He faces the problem of inadequate capital with which to buy more advanced hair-cutting machines. His personal goals are building a permanent home and buying a motorcycle to use for transportation. He also intends to expand his business and to diversify his services to include offering manicures and pedicures.

Patrick is requesting a loan in order to buy new hair-cutting machines.

loans.use: to buy new hair-cutting machines

loans.name: Sabino Olmedo

texts.es: Sabino vive en el sur de Guayaquil conocido como el Suburbio. A sus 60 años tiene una profesión poco común en hombres, el es sastre. Empezó hace 40 años aprendiendo de su tío quien tenía esta misma profesión, le gusto mucho por lo que realizo varios cursos para ampliar sus conocimientos y mejorar las técnicas. Sabino comenta que en todo trabajo lo que más cuenta es la experiencia  que se adquiere con el tiempo y el ya tiene bastante. Trabaja solo de lunes a domingos desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde siempre que termine con el pedido. Su especialidad son los ternos de caballeros los cuales tienen gran acogida, también confecciona camisas, pantalones unisex, blusas y uniformes. El taller está ubicado en su domicilio donde tiene su máquina y una mesa para el corte. El mayor problema que enfrenta sabino es la entrega de las prendas una vez terminadas, como se mueve en busetas teme que los ladrones roben su trabajo. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de otra máquina de coser ya que la actual esta vieja y necesita un cambio, igual no la desechara ya que de necesitar contratar alguien le serviría. Espera a futuro comprar una maquina industrial con la que brindaría mejores servicios.
texts.en:
Sabino lives in the south of Guayaquil in a place known as El Suburbio.  At the age of 60 he has a profession that’s uncommon in men; he’s a tailor.  
He started out 40 years ago learning from his uncle who was in the same profession.  He liked it very much so he took several courses to expand his knowledge and improve his skills.  Sabino comments that in all the work what he likes best is the experience that’s acquired with time and he already has quite a bit.

He works by himself from Monday through Sunday from 7am until 6pm to complete his orders.  His specialty is men’s three-piece suits which are well-received.  He also makes shirts, unisex pants, blouses and uniforms.  His workshop is located at home where he has his machine and a cutting table.

The greatest problem Sabino faces is delivering his completed items because since he uses the minibuses to get around he fears thieves might steal his work.  He will use the requested loan to buy another sewing machine since the one he has is old and he needs a change.  He won’t get rid of it, however, because if he were to hire someone they could use it.  He hopes in future to buy an industrial machine that can be used to provide better service.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: La Chomba Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Chombas lo conforman cinco personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Juana Francisca de 34 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de frutas, leña y una pequeña venta de granos básicos en su hogar desde hace 8 años. El crédito lo invertirá en productos para la venta y compra de cosechas.
Ella tiene 4 hijos  de los cuales los dos menores de 15 y 16 años de edad son los que dependen de ella.
Las otras integrantes son Petrona de 57 años quien tiene una tortillería, vende leña y verduras desde hace 3 años, Ana Gabriela tiene una pulpería desde hace 7 años, Ana María tiene una pulpería y Fátima vende verduras, leña y electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
The group Las Chombas consists of five hard-working entreprenurial women.  One of the women, Juana Francisca, is 34 years old and has sold fruit, firewood, and staple grains from her home for 8 years.  She will invest the loan in products to sell and the purchase of harvests.  She has four children of which the two youngest, who are 15 and 16 years old, depend on her. 

The other members of the group are Petrona who is 57 years old and owns a tortilla shop and has sold firewood and vegetables for three years; Ana Gabriela who has owned a small grocery store for seven years; Ana Maria who owns a small grocery store; and Fatima who sells vegetables, firewood, and electric household appliances.

loans.use: to buy harvested crops and staple grains.

loans.name: Martina Liliana

texts.es:
La Sra. Martina trabaja como profesora en una escuela de primaria publica desde hace 28 años, es casada y con un hijo a cargo.

Doña Martina es su primer crédito con nuestra institución y pretende mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio este crédito realizado mejora en su casa de habitación comprando zinc, perlines y cemento para reparar un dormitorio.
texts.en: Martina has worked as a teacher in a primary school for 28 years.  She is married and has one son.  This is her first loan through our institution, and she intends to improve her living conditions.  With the loan proceeds, she will purchase home improvement materials such as zinc, cement and wooden beams that will be used to repair a bedroom.

loans.use: to purchase home improvement materials.

loans.name: Glenda Ninoska

texts.es:
La Sra. Glenda trabaja como profesora en una escuela de primaria publica desde hace 4 años, es casada y con un hijo a cargo.

Doña Glenda es su primer crédito con nuestra institución y pretende mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio este crédito realizado compras de bienes del hogar  como una cocina y sus utensilios.
texts.en: Glenda has worked as an elementary school teacher for four years.  She’s married and has a son in her care.  This is Glenda’s first loan with our institution and she intends to improve her living conditions with it.  She will use the loan to buy items for the home like a stove and utensils.

loans.use: to buy a stove and utensils.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro, age 45, runs a local brew business in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a hardworking man who has been engaged in his business for over 10 years. His primary obstacles are inadequate capital to facilitate his business and customers not paying on time. 

Teodoro's most immediate goals are to build a permanent home for the family and to secure the education of his children. He would also like to buy land that he will use for growing crops.

Teodoro intends to use this loan to buy building materials for the completion of his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for completion of the family house

loans.name: Yenit Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Yenit trabaja como profesora en una escuela de primaria publica desde hace 5 años, es casada y con dos hijos a cargo.

Doña Yenit es su primer crédito con nuestra institución y pretende mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio este crédito realizado compra de lentes para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y laboral.
texts.en: Yenit has been working as an elementary school teacher for five years.  She’s married and has two children in her care.  This is Yenit’s first loan with our institution and she intends to improve her living conditions with it buying eyeglasses to improve her living and working conditions.

loans.use: to buy eyeglasses.

loans.name: Yakobo

texts.en:
Yakobo, age 64, operates a bar business. He has run this business for 15 years. He and his wife have three children and live in Kagadi, Uganda. Yakobo started his bar business with capital obtained from selling produce, which was his original activity. Inadequate capital is the primary element affecting the business. 

Yakobo would like to build rental houses so as to increase his sources of income and to hire employees to help him expand his business. He is requesting a loan in order to buy building materials so that he can complete his rental houses.

loans.use: to buy building materials so that he can finish building his rental houses

loans.name: Yuri Elizabeth

texts.es: Yuri es una madre soltera de 38 años con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Vive en el sur de Guayaquil en la Isla Trinitaria, a pesar de ser una zona sur urbana cuenta con los servicios básicos, alcantarillado y caminos pavimentados. Yuri empezó a vender productos por catálogos hace 5 años ofreciendo a sus familiares y amigos, también empezó a recorrer los sectores por su domicilio siendo así que ahora tiene mucha acogida. El negocio lo atiende sola a cualquier hora llevando las revistas y los productos que tenga, lo hace de esta manera ya que generalmente compra productos en promoción como perfumes, maquillaje al 2x1, cremas, desodorantes ya que son más económicos y los vende al precio actual haciendo un leve descuento. Esta estrategia le a sido de mucha utilidad ya que la competencia es muy agresiva pero así a logrado mantener a sus clientes. Yuri va a utilizar el préstamo comprando mayor cantidad de productos en promoción para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Yuri, 38, is a single mother who very much wants to get ahead.  She lives in south Guayaquil in Isla Trinitaria.  Despite it’s being a suburban zone it has basic services, drainage and paved roads.

Yuri started out selling catalogue products five years ago to her family members and friends.  She also started going through the areas near her house so that now she’s very well-received.  

She tends to her business by herself at all hours taking catalogues and whatever products she has on hand.  She does it this way because she usually buys products that are on sale like perfume and two-for-one make-up, cream and deodorants since they are more economical and she can sell them at their normal price giving small discounts.  

This strategy has been very useful because competition is aggressive but she’s managed to retain her customers this way.  Yuri will use the loan to buy larger amounts of products that are on special promotion to subsequently resell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Víctor Raúl

texts.es: Víctor Raúl de veintiocho años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia valiosa que utiliza a la hora de la siembra, el terreno es muy grande y se ubica en un lugar con incidencia agrícola, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas al lugar y ya tiene clientela fija pues saben que todo lo que vende es de calidad y a precios bajos, además trabaja como mesero en un restaurante; Víctor eso un hombre visionario, con muchas metas que desea alcanzar para llegar al éxito, en la última temporada tuvo grandes pérdidas debido a los cambios de clima, en esta ocasión quiere recuperarse y desea invertir en insumos, pero necesita de capital por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, maicillo, abono, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Víctor Raúl tiene capacidad de pago y es muy responsable tiene la confianza que cancelara a tiempo y a la vez podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Víctor Raúl is twenty-eight years old and he lives with his life partner and their children. He is a farmer, specifically growing corn and sorghum. He’s been in this line of work for several years and has acquired valuable experience he uses to plant the seeds. His field is very big and it is located in a zone of intense agricultural activity. He sells his products in all the surrounding areas and has fixed customers because they know that everything he sells is of good quality and comes at low prices. On top of this he also works as a waiter in a restaurant. Víctor is a man with a vision with many goals he wants to reach to be successful. During the last season he suffered heavy losses because of the changes in the weather, and in this occasion he wants to get back on track. For this reason he wants to invest in supplies, but as he needs working capital he is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL to buy corn seeds, sorghum, manure, insecticide and weed-killers. Víctor Raul had good repayment references and he is very responsible; he is sure her will repay his loan on time and that he will succeed in granting a good life to his family.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds, sorghum, manure, insecticide and weed-killers.

loans.name: Yahaira Yesenia

texts.es:
La Sra. Yahaira trabaja como profesora en un instituto de secundaria público desde hace 10 años, es acompañada.

Doña Yahaira es su primer crédito con nuestra institución y pretende mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio este crédito realizado el trámite de diploma de licenciatura ya que se encuentra en su último año lectivo.
texts.en: Yahaira has worked as a secondary school teacher for the last ten years; she has a spouse.  This is her first loan with our institution and she intends to improve her living conditions with it by paying fees for her bachelor’s degree since she’s in her last year of study.

loans.use: to pay diploma fees.

loans.name: Marilena

texts.es: Marilena de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad  frijoles, pan, huevos, jabón, entre otros, además posee una pupusería, vende pupusas de frijol con queso, queso, revueltas, las más deliciosas del lugar,  es muy conocida en la localidad pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan, con producto de calidad y a precios accesibles  además el servicio es único se caracteriza por ser una excelente vendedora; Marilena es una mujer visionaria, con grandes expectativas para su futuro quiere llegar el éxito y está luchando por lograrlo, le gusta mantenerse adelante de su competencia por eso quiere aumentar sus negocios, necesita invertir en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, quesillo, chicharrón, verduras, etc. Marilena responsable, con buenas referencias de pago, tiene la confianza que podrá cancelar el financiamiento y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marilena is fifty-five years old and she lives with her life partner and their children. She runs a store where she sells basic necessities such as beans, bread, eggs, soap and more. She also runs a pupuseria (a shop selling 'pupusas', a traditional Salvadoran dish) selling the most delicious pupusas with cheese and beans, cheese and stuffed flatbread of her area. She is well-known in her community because she always has what people need, she sells quality products at affordable prices, she offers a unique service and she distinguishes herself for being an excellent retailer. Marilena is a woman with a vision and great expectations for her future. She wants to be successful and she is striving to achieve it. She likes to be one step ahead of her competitors and for this reason she wants to improve her activities. She needs to invest in supplies and for this reason she is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL to buy basic grains, instant foods, sweets, drinks, curd, fried pork skin and vegetables. Marilena is responsible, she can count on good credit references and she is sure she will repay her loan and that she will offer a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, instant foods, sweets, drinks, curd, fried pork skin and vegetables.

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Marta es una mujer quien trabaja como conserje en una institución del estado desde hace 10 años, es madre soltera y cuya familia está conformada por ella y sus 2 hijos.

La Sra. Marta es su tercer crédito que tiene con nuestra institución y lo quiere para comprar material para construcción como: zinc, madera, clavos y pago de mano de obra para darle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Marta is a woman who has been working as a caretaker at a state institution for the last ten years.  She’s a single mother whose family is composed of her and her two children.

This is Marta’s third loan with our institution and she wants it to buy building supplies like metal sheeting, lumber and nails and to pay labor costs for the construction project to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria de 23 años vive en Isla Trinitaria en la casa de sus padres. Se caso muy joven ya que tiene un niño de 3 años de edad a quien cuida ya que no asiste a la escuela, su esposo tiene una peluquería la cual atiende. Antes de casarse a ella le gustaba mucho el comercio y ya trabajaba con el fin de tener dinero para sus gastos, siempre ha sido emprendedora por lo que continua con la venta de productos de belleza. Lo que más vende son perfumes, ya sean nacionales o extranjeros, los extranjeros los consigue por medio de un amigo que exporta y al venderlos obtiene más ganancias. Trabaja todos los días sin descanso desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche haciendo sus recorridos promocionando o cobrando a sus clientes. Maria indica que esta temporada es más difícil ya que las lluvias dañan los caminos que recorre. El préstamo que está solicitando Maria es para arreglar el negocio de su esposa y poder abrir un local ahí, comprara vitrinas, cemento, arena y piedra para la adecuación. Su sueño a futuro es comprar una casa propia para vivir con comodidad.
texts.en:
Maria, 23, lives in Isla Trinitaria in her parents' home. She married very young and already has a three-year-old boy whom she takes care of. He does not yet attend school.  Her husband has a barbershop, in which she assists him.  After she got married, she began to enjoy the business and has been working with the aim of meeting her daily expenses.  She has always been an enterprising woman, and she now sells beauty products.

Her biggest selling items are perfumes, whether they are from Ecuador or other countries.  She obtains the foreign perfumes through a friend who has an export business.  She works all day without rest from 7 in the morning until 9 at night, making her rounds promoting her products or collecting payment from her customers.

Maria reports that this season has been more difficult since the rains have damaged the streets where she sells her products.  The loan she is seeking is to renovate her husband's barbershop to make space for her to sell her own products there.  The funds will be used to buy glass, cement, sand and stones for the construction.  Her dream for the future is to be able to buy her own home where she can live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her business.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
La señora Elba es clienta de la organización quien primero pàrticipo del programa de servicios financieros como integrante de un Banco Mujer, despues toma la decisión de trasladarse a la cartera de préstamos individuales, ella habita junto con su familia en la Zona Sur de Costa Rica, especificamente en la provincia de Puntarenas, en el cantón de Corredores, en el distrito de La Cuesta, en el sector de Bella Luz de la Vaca, especificamente en Río Incendio, donde desarrolla desde hace varios años la actividad de porcicultura, cria de cerdos para engorde, los que se comercializan a travez de compradores que llegan hasta estos lugares, para comprarlos en pié(cerdos vivos), los que posteriormente ellos venden a las carnicerias.
Esta zona se caracteriza por el cultivo de palma aceitera, actividad agricola que demanda mano de obra femenina, sin embargo la demanda supera a la oferta de empleo, de allí que muchas mujeres se vean en la necesidad de crear sus propias fuentes de empleo, que les garanticen una ayuda importante a la economia del hogar, asi como poder criar a sus dos hijos menores que estan en edad escolar.
Como un plan a corto plazo la señora Elba quiere ampliar a un mas esta actividad productiva, ya que considera que le genera buenos dividendos y algo que para ella es importante es poder estar al lado de sus hijos, y la actividad se lo permite
texts.en:
Elba is a client of the institution who first participated in financial services as a member of a communal bank and later decided to switch over to individual loans.  She and her family live in a zone in south Costa Rica, specifically in Puntarenas Province in Corredores Canton, La Cuesta District in Bella Luz de la Vaca Sector, specifically in Río Incendio where she’s been raising pigs for several years that she sells through buyers that come to these places to buy them on the hoof (live pigs) that they subsequently sell to butcher shops.

This zone is noted for producing palm oil, an agricultural activity that demands a large female work force.  However, supply exceeds demand so many women need to create their own sources of employment that guarantee income for their homes while being able to raise her two minor children who are school age.

As a short-term goal, Elba wants to expand this productive activity more since she feels that it generates good profits and something that’s important for her is to be able to be alongside her children and this activity allows her to do so.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn, age 27, sells vegetables in her village. She and her husband Joey have three young children and live in Estefania. Joey buys and sells junk items and other recyclable products for profit, while Renalyn is engaged in her vegetable sales venture. From their two businesses, the couple earns PhP 10,000 each month. 

Renalyn would like to sell more vegetables, which is why she is borrowing PhP 17,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes, and string beans to offer for sale. Part of the loan will be used to buy more junk items. The additional revenue generated will be invested in their children's education. 

In the future, Renalyn hopes to see both their businesses thrive so that they can achieve a progressive life for the family.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, and string beans to offer for sale

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Managing a small store in front of her house keeps Clarita busy with her daily routine in Estefania. She untiringly attends to her customers' demand for the affordable, high-quality merchandise she sells. She has sold grocery items for over five years now. Clarita's husband is a farmer and they have two children. 

Clarita joined ASKI and has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 33,000 to invest in expanding the business. With the loan funds, she will buy soft drinks, eggs, bread, milk, sugar, and coffee to offer for sale in her store. By stocking more grocery items in her store, she is confident that she will earn more profit from her business. 

In the future, Clarita hopes to achieve more sales and become a progressive entrepreneur. She believes that this will also help to provide a progressive life for her children someday.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, bread, milk, sugar, and coffee to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Lázaro Osmin

texts.es: Lázaro Osmin de veinticuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo; él se dedica a la carpintería elabora toda clase de muebles, como mesas, sillas, bancos, sillones,etc. tiene varios años de dedicarse a este rubro  se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite mejorar cada día la calidad de su trabajo, su negocio está ubicado en su vivienda ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que el trabajo de Lázaro es de calidad, fabrica al gusto del cliente, da buenos precios pero sobre todo un servicio inigualable y entrega lo solicitado lo antes posible; él es un hombre entregado a su labor, ama lo que hace él tiene grandes metas a futuro y planea trabajar duro para lograrlo y as llegar al éxito, en estos últimos meses ha aumentado la demanda y por lo tanto Lázaro quiere aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar madera por mayor en diferentes clases, herramienta, clavos, etc. Lázaro Osmin no tiene experiencia en créditos pero si posee buenas referencias de pago de algunos vecinos y amigos, él tiene la certeza que cancelara el financiamiento en el periodo establecido y a la vez le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Lázaro Osmin is twenty-four years old and he lives with his life partner and their son. He is a carpenter creating every kind o furniture items, such as tables, chairs, benches, armchairs and more. He’s been in this line of business for many years and has acquired valuable experience that allows him to improve the quality go his job on a daily basis- His activity is located in his house, and he has many customers because people know that Lázaro does a quality job, that his creations follow the customer’s taste, that his prices are goof and above all that he provides an unsurpassable service, delivering the requested products as soon as possible. He is dedicated to his job, he loves what he does and he has great goals for his future, and he plans on working hard to reach them and achieve success. In these past few months there has been an increase in the requests, and therefore Lázaro wants to increase his production: he is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL to buy different kinds of wood at wholesale prices, tools and nails. Lázaro Osmin does not have any experience with loans but some neighbors and friends gave good credit references for him. He is sure he will repay his loan in the established time and that he will grant a better standard of living to his family.

loans.use: To buy wood at wholesale prices, tools and nails.

loans.name: Sam Ol

texts.en:
Sam Ol, age 44, earns a living by selling fish. She has been engaged in this work for over 10 years and she earns approximately $10 per day. She lives with her husband and their four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband helps her run the business. One of her children is a hairdresser who earns about $3 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sam Ol is requesting a loan of $1,100 in order to purchase a motorcycle for commuting. This purchase will help her to transport her fish to sell in larger amounts, allowing her to earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a truck for carrying her fish to market and to help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Super Poderosas  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Súper Poderosas  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace cuatro meses atrás  y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han mejorado  sus pequeños negocios y su vida. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es  la señora Mariana, tiene  47 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, todos mayores e independientes. El marido es comerciante.
 
Nuestra amiga para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, agua en bidón entre otras cosas, nos cuenta además que dos veces por mes  con su marido se van a la ciudad de  Esmeraldas a vender ella ropa y su marido zapatos y sandalias, ellos se quedad en este lugar todo el fin de semana vendiendo sus productos. En estos días uno de sus hijos se hace cargo de atender la tienda. Ella lleva más de 15 años dedicada al comercio y con su tiendita tres años, pero comenta que si le da ganancias y que espera con los créditos ir aumentando su tienda.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The “Las Súper Poderosas” (The Super Powerful Ones) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place noted for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feast day of Saint Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

This is a group of people who decided to join together four months ago and form this communal bank that’s been very useful to them with loans.  They have improved their small businesses and their lives.  They carry out a variety of activities like agriculture, general commerce and services, among other activities.

One of the group members is Mariana, 47.  She’s in a common law relationship and has five children, all independent adults.  Her husband’s a merchant.

In order to get ahead with her family, our friend has a home-based store where she sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent and bottled water, among other things.  She tells us that she also goes with her husband twice a month to the city of Esmeraldas where she sells clothes and her husband sells shoes and sandals.  They stay there the entire weekend selling their products.  During those days one of their children is in charge of tending to the store.  She’s been a merchant for 15 years and has had her store for three years but she comments that it does produce profits and she hopes to expand the store with the loans.
 
She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cured meats and other basic staple products.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her goals are to continue forward with her business and that her store grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy staple items to stock her store.

loans.name: Kiizito

texts.en: Kiizito is a hard working gentleman who operates a retail shop that he has run for a period of 10 years now. He started with capital earned from agriculture which he practiced for a long period. He says price fluctuation is a factor affecting his business. He would like to educate his children and buy land to grow crops and diversify his business. Kiziito wants a loan to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to sell.
